content.question:
<math alttext="F e with a positive 2 charge aqueous plus Z n solid react to produce F e solid plus Z n with a positive 2 charge aqueous. E naught sub cell equals positive 0.32 volt" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Fe</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mtext>Zn(</mtext><mi>s</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>→</mo><mtext>Fe(</mtext><mi>s</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>Zn</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="3.0em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>l</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>0.32</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
A galvanic cell generates a cell potential of <math alttext="positive 0.32 volt" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>0.32</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> when operated under standard conditions according to the reaction above. Which of the following pairs of conditions are needed to construct a similar cell that generates the lowest cell potential?

choices.label: <math alttext="the molar concentration of Z n with a positive 2 charge equals 0.5 molar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>Zn</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>]</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>0.5</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="the molar concentration of F e with a positive 2 charge equals 1 molar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>Fe</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>]</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> because <math alttext="Q is less than 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo><</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="the molar concentration of Z n with a positive 2 charge equals 1 molar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>Zn</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>]</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="the molar concentration of F e with a positive 2 charge equals 2 molar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>Fe</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>]</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> because <math alttext="Q is greater than 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo>></mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="the molar concentration of Z n with a positive 2 charge equals 2 molar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>Zn</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>]</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="the molar concentration of F e with a positive 2 charge equals 0.5 molar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>Fe</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>]</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>0.5</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> because <math alttext="Q is greater than 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo>></mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="the molar concentration of Z n with a positive 2 charge equals 2 molar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>Zn</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>]</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="the molar concentration of F e with a positive 2 charge equals 1 molar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>Fe</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>]</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> because <math alttext="Q is less than 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo><</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: <math alttext="the molar concentration of Z n with a positive 2 charge equals 2 molar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>Zn</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>]</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="the molar concentration of F e with a positive 2 charge equals 0.5 molar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>Fe</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>]</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>0.5</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> because <math alttext="Q is greater than 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo>></mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: 6.D: Provide reasoning to justify a claim using chemical principles or laws, or using mathematical justification.
